longDef.en: understanding of or information about a subject that you get by experience or study, either known by one person or by people generally
longDef.cn: 知识;学问;学识;了解;理解

examples.en: Her knowledge of English grammar is very extensive.
examples.cn: 她的英语语法知识很广博。

examples.en: He has a limited knowledge of French.
The details of the scandal are now common knowledge (= familiar to most people).
examples.cn: 丑闻的详情现在众所周知。

examples.en: She started to photograph the documents, safe in the knowledge that (= knowing that) she wouldn't be disturbed for at least an hour.
examples.cn: 她开始对文件拍照，确信至少一小时内不会有人打扰。

examples.en: In this town there are only a couple of restaurants that to my knowledge (= judging from my personal experience and information) serve good food.
examples.cn: 据我所知，这个镇上只有几家餐馆菜品不错。

longDef.en: the state of knowing about or being familiar with something

examples.en: They both deny all knowledge of the affair.
examples.cn: 他们俩完全否认知道此事。

examples.en: It has come/been brought to our knowledge (= we have discovered) that several computers have gone missing.
examples.cn: 我们发现有几台电脑不见了。
